data.enText: swept
swept

data.chText: 用刷子或手
data.enText: with brush or hand

data.chText: 扫；打扫；清扫
data.enText: to clean a room, surface, etc. using a broom (= a type of brush on a long handle)

data.chText: 清扫地板
data.enText: to sweep the floor

data.chText: 陈列室已经清理出来，打扫干净了。
data.enText: The showroom had been emptied and swept clean.

data.chText: 扫去；清除
data.enText: to remove sth from a surface using a brush, your hand, etc.

data.chText: 她把面包屑扫进废纸篓里。
data.enText: She swept the crumbs into the wastebasket.

data.chText: 他把树叶扫成一堆。
data.enText: He swept the leaves up into a pile.

data.chText: 快速 / 猛烈移动
data.enText: move quickly/with force

data.chText: （迅猛地）推送，吹走，冲走，带走
data.enText: to move or push sb/sth suddenly and with a lot of force

data.chText: 小船被吹到大海的深处去了。
data.enText: The little boat was swept out to sea.

data.chText: 她任由自己被人流挟裹着前行。
data.enText: She let herself be swept along by the crowd.

data.chText: 猛烈吹过；掠过；席卷；横扫
data.enText: to move suddenly and/or with force over an area or in a particular direction

data.chText: 雨水从破窗户灌进屋内。
data.enText: Rain swept in through the broken windows.

data.chText: 这些岛屿上经常刮大风。
data.enText: Strong winds regularly sweep the islands.

data.chText: 人
data.enText: of a person

data.chText: 步态轻盈地走；大模大样地走
data.enText: to move quickly and/or smoothly, especially in a way that impresses or is intended to impress other people

data.chText: 她再没说话，大模大样地走出房间。
data.enText: Without another word she swept out of the room.

data.chText: 他以几近完美的表现跨入领先位置。
data.enText: He swept into the lead with an almost perfect performance.

data.chText: 挥动，舞动（手、臂等）
data.enText: to move sth, especially your hand or arm, quickly and smoothly in a particular direction

data.chText: 他张开双臂舞动着，冲过去迎接她。
data.enText: He rushed to greet her, sweeping his arms wide.

data.chText: 感受
data.enText: of feelings

data.chText: 突然袭来
data.enText: to suddenly affect sb strongly

data.chText: 她感到浑身疲惫。
data.enText: A wave of tiredness swept over her.

data.chText: 往事倏地重又浮现在脑海中。
data.enText: Memories came sweeping back.

data.chText: 思想；时尚
data.enText: of ideas/fashions

data.chText: 迅速传播
data.enText: to spread quickly

data.chText: 他辞职的传言在全公司传播开了。
data.enText: Rumours of his resignation swept through the company.

data.chText: 风靡美国的最新时尚
data.enText: the latest craze sweeping America

data.chText: 扫视；掠过
data.enText: look/move over area

data.chText: 扫视；掠过；搜索
data.enText: to move over an area, especially in order to look for sth

data.chText: 他的目光把房间扫视了一遍。
data.enText: His eyes swept around the room.

data.chText: 探照灯在空中扫来扫去。
data.enText: Searchlights swept the sky.

data.chText: 轻触表面
data.enText: touch surface

data.chText: （使）轻轻掠过，轻轻擦过
data.enText: to move, or move sth, over a surface, touching it lightly

data.chText: 她行走时衣裙拖在地上。
data.enText: Her dress swept the ground as she walked.

data.chText: 头发
data.enText: hair

data.chText: 梳；刷；掠
data.enText: to brush, comb , etc. your hair in a particular direction

data.chText: 她的头发是从前边往后梳的。
data.enText: Her hair was swept back from her face.

data.chText: 地貌
data.enText: of landscape

data.chText: 蜿蜒；呈缓坡延伸
data.enText: to form a long smooth curve

data.chText: 旅馆的花园呈缓坡一直延伸到海滩。
data.enText: The hotel gardens sweep down to the beach.

data.chText: 体育运动
data.enText: in sport

data.chText: （在系列比赛中）获得全部胜利，囊括各项冠军
data.enText: to win all the games in a series of games against another team or all the parts of a contest

data.chText: 蓝鸟队有机会囊括这一系列比赛的冠军。
data.enText: The Blue Jays have a chance to sweep the series.

data.chText: 在上个赛季，新泽西队全胜底特律队。
data.enText: New Jersey swept Detroit last season.
sweep the board

data.chText: （在比赛中）囊括所有奖项
data.enText: to win all the prizes, etc. in a competition
sweep sb off their feet

data.chText: 使某人立刻迷上自己；使某人对自己一见倾心
data.enText: to make sb fall suddenly and deeply in love with you
sweep (sb) to power

data.chText: （使某人）以压倒性优势在选举中获胜
data.enText: to win an election by a large number of votes; to make sb win an election with a large number of votes
sweep to victory

data.chText: 轻易赢得（竞赛）
data.enText: to win a contest easily

data.chText: 工党在2001年轻松取胜。
data.enText: Labour swept to victory in 2001.
sweep sth under the carpet
sweep sth under the rug

data.chText: 掩盖某事
data.enText: to try to stop people from finding out about sth wrong, illegal, embarrassing, etc. that has happened or that you have done
sweep sb along/away

data.chText: 使某人醉心；驱使某人专注
data.enText: to make sb very interested or involved in sth, especially in a way that makes them forget everything else

data.chText: 他们受感情的威力所驱使。
data.enText: They were swept along by the force of their emotions.
sweep sth↔aside

data.chText: 对…置之不理；不理会；全然无视
data.enText: to ignore sth completely

data.chText: 他们所有的忠告全被当成了耳边风。
data.enText: All their advice was swept aside.
sweep sth↔away

data.chText: 消灭；彻底消除；完全打消
data.enText: to get rid of sth completely

data.chText: 一切怀疑早已完全消除。
data.enText: Any doubts had long since been swept away.
sweep sth↔out

data.chText: 打扫干净，清扫干净（房间等）
data.enText: to remove all the dust, dirt, etc. from a room or building using a brush
sweep sb↔up

data.chText: 一把抱起某人
data.enText: to lift sb up with a sudden smooth movement

data.chText: 他一把将她抱进怀里。
data.enText: He swept her up into his arms.

data.chText: 用刷子
data.enText: with brush

data.chText: 扫；打扫；清扫
data.enText: an act of cleaning a room, surface, etc. using a broom

data.chText: 把房间好好打扫一下。
data.enText: Give the room a good sweep.

data.chText: 挥动
data.enText: curving movement

data.chText: 挥动；掠
data.enText: a smooth curving movement

data.chText: 他一挥胳膊指向门。
data.enText: He indicated the door with a sweep of his arm.

data.chText: 地貌
data.enText: landscape

data.chText: （道路、河流、海岸等）一长段，绵延弯曲的地带，呈缓坡状的地带
data.enText: a long, often curved, piece of road, river, coast, etc.

data.chText: 环绕海湾的一片白色悬崖
data.enText: the broad sweep of white cliffs around the bay

data.chText: 范围
data.enText: range

data.chText: 广泛性；广博的范围；广度
data.enText: the range of an idea, a piece of writing, etc. that considers many different things

data.chText: 她的著作涵盖了该国漫长的历史。
data.enText: Her book covers the long sweep of the country's history.

data.chText: 巡行；搜索
data.enText: movement/search over area

data.chText: 巡行；搜索；扫荡
data.enText: a movement over an area, for example in order to search for sth or attack sth

data.chText: 救援直升机在海湾上空又搜索了一遍。
data.enText: The rescue helicopter made another sweep over the bay.

data.chText: 烟囱
data.enText: chimney

data.chText: 赌博
data.enText: gambling
sweeps

data.chText: 体育运动
data.enText: in sport

data.chText: （两支球队对赛其中一方）全胜的一系列比赛；囊括冠军
data.enText: a series of games that a team wins against another team; the fact of winning all the parts of a contest

data.chText: 在世界职业棒球系列赛中囊括冠军
data.enText: a World Series sweep

data.chText: 电视
data.enText: television

data.chText: 收视率调查（电视台为查明节目受欢迎度，尤为计算广告费）
data.enText: a time when television companies examine their programmes to find out which ones are the most popular, especially in order to calculate advertising rates
make a clean sweep (of sth)

data.chText: 全部撤换；彻底清除
data.enText: to remove all the people or things from an organization that are thought to be unnecessary or need changing

data.chText: （比赛或竞赛中）大获全胜，包揽（所有奖项）；获得选举全胜
data.enText: to win all the prizes or parts of a game or competition; to win an election completely

data.chText: 中国队在体操比赛中包揽了所有的奖牌。
data.enText: China made a clean sweep of the medals in the gymnastics events.

data.chText: 民意测验表明民主党有可能大获全胜。
data.enText: The opinion poll suggests a clean sweep for the Democrats.

word_means: 获得全部胜利，囊括各项冠军
一长段，绵延弯曲的地带，呈缓坡状的地带

means: （在系列比赛中）获得全部胜利，囊括各项冠军
(道路、河流、海岸等)一长段，绵延弯曲的地带，呈缓坡状的地带

ex.zh: 卷走某人/某物；将某人/某物迅速送走

data.chText: 中国队在体操比赛中包揽了所有的奖牌。
data.enText: China made a clean sweep of the medals in the gymnastics events.

data.enText: to make sb very interested or involved in sth, especially in a way that makes them forget everything else

data.chText: 他们受感情的威力所驱使。
data.enText: They were swept along by the force of their emotions.

data.enText: All their advice was swept aside.

data.enText: to remove all the dust, dirt, etc. from a room or building using a brush

tr: (American football) an attempt to advance the ball by running around the end of the line
a long oar used in an open boat
winning all or all but one of the tricks in bridge
someone who cleans soot from chimneys
win an overwhelming victory in or on
example: Her new show dog swept all championships

tr: sweep with a broom or as if with a broom
example: Sweep the crumbs off the table

tr: make a big sweeping gesture or movement
move with sweeping, effortless, gliding motions
example: The diva swept into the room
Shreds of paper sailed through the air
The searchlights swept across the sky
Her long skirt brushed the floor
A gasp swept cross the audience

tr: force into some kind of situation, condition, or course of action
example: They were swept up by the events
don't drag me into this business

tr: to cover or extend over an area or time period
example: Rivers traverse the valley floor", "The parking lot spans 3 acres

value.def: If you sweep an area of floor or ground, you push dirt or rubbish off it using a brush with a long handle.

example.ex: The owner of the store was sweeping his floor when I walked in...
example.tran: 当我走进商店的时候，店主正在扫地。

example.ex: She was in the kitchen sweeping crumbs into a dust pan...
example.tran: 她正在厨房把面包屑扫入簸箕里。

example.ex: Norma picked up the broom and began sweeping.
example.tran: 诺尔玛拿起扫帚开始扫了起来。

value.def: If you sweep things off something, you push them off with a quick smooth movement of your arm.

example.ex: I swept rainwater off the flat top of a gravestone...
example.tran: 我拂去了墓碑顶上的雨水。

example.ex: With a gesture of frustration, she swept the cards from the table...
example.tran: 她懊恼地把桌子上的牌都拂到了地上。

example.ex: 'Thanks friend,' he said, while sweeping the money into his pocket.
example.tran: “谢了，朋友，”他说着就把钱划拉进了口袋。

value.def: If someone with long hair sweeps their hair into a particular style, they put it into that style.

example.ex: ...stylish ways of sweeping your hair off your face...
example.tran: 露出脸形的时髦发式

example.ex: Her long, fine hair was swept back in a ponytail.
example.tran: 她长长的秀发在脑后梳成一个马尾。

value.def: If your arm or hand sweeps in a particular direction, or if you sweep it there, it moves quickly and smoothly in that direction.

example.ex: His arm swept around the room...
example.tran: 他伸出手臂绕着房间挥了一圈。

example.ex: Daniels swept his arm over his friend's shoulder.
example.tran: 丹尼尔斯把胳膊搭在了他朋友的肩上。

example.ex: ...the long sweeping arm movements of a violinist.
example.tran: 小提琴演奏者的大幅度挥臂动作

example.ex: With one sweep of her hand she threw back the sheets.
example.tran: 她手一挥掀开了床单。

value.def: If wind, a stormy sea, or another strong force sweeps someone or something along, it moves them quickly along.

example.ex: ...landslides that buried homes and swept cars into the sea...
example.tran: 埋没家园并把汽车卷入大海的山体滑坡

example.ex: Suddenly, she was swept along by the crowd.
example.tran: 一时间，她被人群推搡着向前走。

value.tran: (风、汹涌的海水等)席卷,横扫,掠过

value.def: If you are swept somewhere, you are taken there very quickly.

example.ex: The visitors were swept past various monuments...
example.tran: 游客们被带着走马观花地参观了各种纪念碑。

example.ex: A limousine swept her along the busy freeway to the airport.
example.tran: 一辆豪华轿车载着她沿着拥挤的高速公路飞速驶向机场。

value.def: If something sweeps from one place to another, it moves there extremely quickly.

example.ex: An icy wind swept through the streets...
example.tran: 一阵寒风扫过街道。

example.ex: The car swept past the gate house.
example.tran: 汽车飞速穿过门楼。

value.def: If events, ideas, or beliefs sweep through a place, they spread quickly through it.

example.ex: A flu epidemic is sweeping through Moscow.
example.tran: 流感正在莫斯科迅速蔓延。

example.ex: ...the wave of patriotism sweeping the country.
example.tran: 席卷全国的爱国主义热潮

value.tran: (事件、思想、信仰)迅速传播,席卷

value.def: If someone sweeps into a place, they walk into it in a proud, confident way, often when they are angry.

example.ex: She swept into the conference room...
example.tran: 她大模大样地走入会议室。

example.ex: Scarlet with rage, she swept past her employer and stormed up the stairs...
example.tran: 她气得涨红了脸，大摇大摆地经过她的上司，冲上了楼。

example.ex: The Chief turned and swept out.
example.tran: 机长转过身，气呼呼地夺门而去。

value.tran: (通常指生气时)大模大样地走,趾高气扬地走

value.def: If a person or thing sweeps something away or aside, they remove it quickly and completely.

example.ex: The commission's conclusions sweep away a decade of denials and cover-ups...
example.tran: 委员会的结论将十年来的否认和掩饰无情地揭开。

example.ex: In times of war, governments often sweep human rights aside...
example.tran: 战争时期，政府经常对人权置之不顾。

example.ex: He swept the names from his mind.
example.tran: 他把这些名字抛诸脑后。

value.def: If lights or someone's eyes sweep an area, they move across the area from side to side.

example.ex: Helicopters with searchlights swept the park which was sealed off...
example.tran: 直升飞机的探照灯来回扫射这个被封锁的公园。

example.ex: Her gaze sweeps rapidly around the room.
example.tran: 她快速地扫视了一下这个房间。

value.def: If land or water sweeps somewhere, it stretches out in a long, wide, curved shape.

example.ex: The land sweeps away from long areas of greenery.
example.tran: 这块地从草木茂盛的狭长地带一直伸展开来。

example.ex: ...the arc of countries that sweeps down from South Korea to Indonesia.
example.tran: 从韩国到印度尼西亚呈弧形伸展开来的几个国家

value.def: A sweep of land or water forms a long, wide, curved shape.

example.ex: The ground fell away in a broad sweep down to the river.
example.tran: 转过一处大弯后，地面消失在与河水相接处。

example.ex: ...the great sweep of the bay.
example.tran: 一大片海湾

value.tran: (道路、河流)绵延弯曲的地带,宽广而弯曲的一长段

value.def: If a person or group sweeps an election or sweeps to victory, they win the election easily.

example.ex: ...a man who's promised to make radical changes to benefit the poor has swept the election...
example.tran: 承诺彻底改善贫困人口状况的候选人轻松赢得了选举。

example.ex: In both republics, centre-right parties swept to power.
example.tran: 两个共和国的中右派政党都轻而易举地夺取了政权。

example.ex: ...voters nostalgic for the free-spending policies of the 1980s swept his Socialists back to power.
example.tran: 选民们很怀念 20 世纪 80 年代的自由支出政策，这使得社会党人轻松重夺政权。

example.ex: ...a sweeping victory.
example.tran: 一场大胜

value.def: If someone makes a sweep of a place, they search it, usually because they are looking for people who are hiding or for an illegal activity.

example.ex: Two of the soldiers swiftly began making a sweep of the premises...
example.tran: 两名士兵立即开始搜索该建筑物。

example.ex: There may be periodic police 'sweeps' of crime in the area.
example.tran: 警方可能对该地区的犯罪活动进行定时的“扫荡”。

value.def: If you refer to the sweep of something, you are indicating that it includes a large number of different events, qualities, or opinions.

example.ex: ...the whole sweep of German social and political history.
example.tran: 德国社会政治的完整历史

value.def: If someone sweeps something bad or wrong under the carpet, or if they sweep it under the rug, they try to prevent people from hearing about it.

example.ex: For a long time this problem has been swept under the carpet.
example.tran: 这一问题被掩盖了很长一段时间。

value.def: If you make a clean sweep of something such as a series of games or tournaments, you win them all.

example.ex: ...the first club to make a clean sweep of all three trophies.
example.tran: 第一个将3项杯赛奖杯悉数收入囊中的俱乐部。

value.tran: 在(比赛中)大获全胜;横扫

value.def: If someone sweeps you off your feet, you fall in love with them very quickly because you find them very attractive or exciting.

example.ex: I was swept off my feet. I had always dreamed of being an officer's wife.
example.tran: 我被迷得神魂颠倒，一直梦想着成为官太太。

value.tran: 使一见倾心;把…一下子迷住

trans: 波及系数；驱油效率；波及效率
大换班，大改变； 彻底的胜利，大胜
扫描输出；清除；扫掉；扫出效应
扫描角度；扫掠角度；散出角度；掠角；后掠角
扫描时间因数；扫描速率；扫频速率；扫描时间因素；扫描率
